member.summary: Sets the data labels font

example.code:
<% Html.Telerik().Chart()
                        .Name("Chart")
                        .Series(series => series
                            .Bar(s => s.Sales)
                            .Labels(labels => labels
                                .Font("14px Verdana, sans-serif")
                                .Visible(true)
                            );
                        )
                        .Render();
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridAjaxBindingSettingsBuilder.OperationMode(Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.GridOperationMode)
member.summary: Gets or sets the operation mode of the grid. By default the grid will make a request to the server when it needs data for paging, sorting, filtering or grouping. If you set the operation mode to GridOperationMode.Client it will make only one request for all data. Any other paging, sorting, filtering or grouping will be performed client-side.

                       .Columns(columns => columns.Bound(o =>

member.summary: Use it to configure Server binding.

member.summary: Use it to configure Ajax binding.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridDataBindingConfigurationBuilder.WebService
member.summary: Use it to configure web service binding.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().Grid()
                        .Name("Grid")
                        .DataBinding(dataBinding => 
                        {
                            dataBinding.WebService().Select("~/Models/Orders.asmx/GetOrders")
                        })
                        .Columns(columns=>
                        {
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
                        })
            %>

member.summary: Gets or sets the operation mode of the grid. By default the grid will make a request to the server when it needs data for paging, sorting, filtering or grouping. If you set the operation mode to GridOperationMode.Client it will make only one request for all data. Any other paging, sorting, filtering or grouping will be performed client-side.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.BindTo``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.TreeViewItem,``0})
member.summary: Binds the TreeView to a list of objects. The TreeView will be "flat" which means a TreeView item will be created for every item in the data source.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action executed for every data bound item.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.TreeViewBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.NavigationBindingFactory{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.TreeViewItem}})
member.summary: Binds the TreeView to a list of objects. The TreeView will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Telerik().TreeView() .Name("TreeView") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to TreeViewItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to TreeViewItem properties ) ) %>

member.param: The action defining the inline handler.

example.code:
<% Html.Telerik().TreeView()
                       .Name("TreeView")
                       .ClientEvents(events => events.OnExpand(() =>
                       {
                            %>
                            function(e) {
                                // event handling code
                            }
                            <%
                       }))
                       .Render();
            %>

                        .Name("TreeView")

                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            });
                        })

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.BindTo(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Binds the grid to a list of objects
member.typeparam: The type of the data item

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().Grid<Order>()
                        .Name("Orders")
                        .Ajax(ajax => ajax.Action("_RelatedGrids_Orders", "Grid", new { customerID = "ALFKI" }))
                        .Columns(columns=>
                        {
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
                        })
                        .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"]);
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.RowAction(System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.GridRow{`0}})
member.summary: Callback for each row.
member.param: Action, which will be executed for each row. You can format the entire row

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().Grid()
                        .Name("Grid")
                        .RowAction(row =>
                        {
                            // "DataItem" is the Order object to which the current row is bound to
                            if (row.DataItem.Freight > 10)
                            {
                                //Set the background of the entire row
                                row.HtmlAttributes["style"] = "background:red;";
                            }
                        });
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.CellAction(System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.GridCell{`0}})
member.summary: Callback for each cell.
member.param: Action, which will be executed for each cell. You can format a concrete cell.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().Grid()
                        .Name("Grid")
                        .CellAction(cell =>
                        {
                           if (cell.Column.Name == "Freight")
                           {
                               if (cell.DataItem.Freight > 10)
                               {
                                   //Set the background of this cell only
                                   cell.HtmlAttributes["style"] = "background:red;";
                               }
                           }
                        });
            %>

                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
                        })
                        .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"])
                        .Groupable(grouping => grouping.Enabled(true);
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.Groupable
member.summary: Allows grouping.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().Grid()
                        .Name("Grid")
                        .Ajax(ajax => ajax.Action("_RelatedGrids_Orders", "Grid", new { customerID = "ALFKI" }))
                        .Columns(columns=>
                        {
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
                        })
                        .BindTo((IEnumerable<Order>)ViewData["Orders"])
                        .Groupable();
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridBuilder`1.WebService(System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Fluent.GridWebServiceSettingsBuilder})
member.summary: Use it to configure web service binding.
member.param: Use builder to set different web service binding settings.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().Grid()
                        .Name("Grid")
                        .WebService(webService => webService.Url("~/Models/Orders.asmx/GetOrders"))
                        .Columns(columns=>
                        {
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderID).Width(100);
                            columns.Add(c => c.OrderDate).Width(200).Format("{0:dd/MM/yyyy}");
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipAddress);
                            columns.Add(c => c.ShipCity).Width(200);
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.MenuBuilder.BindTo(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.NavigationBindingFactory{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.MenuItem}})
member.summary: Binds the menu to a list of objects. The menu will create a hierarchy of items using the specified mappings.
member.typeparam: The type of the data item
member.param: The action which will configure the mappings

example.code: <%= Html.Telerik().Menu() .Name("Menu") .BindTo(Model, mapping => mapping .For<Customer>(binding => binding .Children(c => c.Orders) // The "child" items will be bound to the the "Orders" property .ItemDataBound((item, c) => item.Text = c.ContactName) // Map "Customer" properties to MenuItem properties ) .For<Order<(binding => binding .Children(o => null) // "Orders" do not have child objects so return "null" .ItemDataBound((item, o) => item.Text = o.OrderID.ToString()) // Map "Order" properties to MenuItem properties ) ) %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItemBuilder.#ctor(Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItem,System.Web.Mvc.ViewContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItemBuilder.Items(System.Action{Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItemFactory})
member.summary: Configures the child items of a .

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().PanelBar()
                        .Name("PanelBar")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            });
                        })
            %>

member.name: M:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.PanelBarItemBuilder.Expanded(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Define when the item will be expanded on intial render.
member.param: If true the item will be expanded.

example.code:
<%= Html.Telerik().PanelBar()
                        .Name("PanelBar")
                        .Items(items =>
                        {
                            items.Add().Text("First Item").Items(firstItemChildren => 
                            {
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 1");
                                firstItemChildren.Add().Text("Child Item 2");
                            })
                            .Expanded(true);
                        })
            %>

member.name: T:Telerik.Web.Mvc.UI.Upload
member.summary:
Telerik Upload for ASP.NET MVC is a view component for uploading files. It supports the following features:
Asynchronous uploading
Progress tracking
Multiple file selection
Drag & drop
Note that some of the features depend on browser capabilities. For more information, see the online documentation.
